intro: Hydrolea caracassana, commonly known as the Brazilian hydrolea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stem and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
